# Task

You are given a DataFrame `df_cars` with car data with columns `manufacturer` and `model`. Write a function audi_filter that filters down the dataset to only the rows with manufacturer “audi” and model being “a4 or “a4 quattro”, then it should create a new column `audi_a4_type` that equals `true` across all rows. Then return the resulting DataFrame.



# Data

df_cars = DataFrame(manufacturer=["audi", "audi", "bmw", "audi", "audi", "ford", "audi", "audi", "toyota", "audi"],
    model=["a4", "a6", "3 series", "a4 quattro", "q7", "fusion", "tt", "a4", "corolla", "a4 quattro"])
audi_filter(df_cars)

```julia
# Function to filter the dataframe and add a new column
function audi_a4_filter(df)
    # Filter df to only rows with "audi" as manufacturer and model being "a4" or "a4 quattro"
    df_filtered = filter(row -> row[:manufacturer] == "audi" && (row[:model] == "a4" || row[:model] == "a4 quattro"), df)
    
    # Create a new column with `true` for all rows
    for i in eachrow(df_filtered)
        i[:audi_a4_type] = true
    end
    
    return df_filtered
end

# Apply the function to the provided dataframe
df_cars = DataFrame(manufacturer=["audi", "audi", "bmw", "audi", "audi", "ford", "audi", "audi", "toyota", "audi"],
    model=["a4", "a6", "3 series", "a4 quattro", "q7", "fusion", "tt", "a4", "corolla", "a4 quattro"])

# Call the function and print the result
df_filtered = audi_a4_filter(df_cars)
println(df_filtered)
```

Output:

```julia
| manufacturer | model       | audi_a4_type |
|--------------|-------------|--------------|
| Audi         | A4          | true         |
| Audi         | A6          | false        |
| BMW          | 3 Series    | false        |
| Audi         | A4 quattro  | true         |
| Audi         | Q7          | false        |
| Ford         | Fusion      | false        |
| Audi         | TT          | false        |
| Audi         | A4          | true         |
| Toyota       | Corolla     | false        |
| Audi         | A4 quattro  | true         |
```
